docblock.description: Contain formated response
Recebe a response HTTP e também dados da assinatura, para alimentar os filtros que definem a relevânca do conteúdo

Faz query no documento, de acordo com os parâmetros definidos na assinatura e define a relevância, sendo que esta relevância pode ser: 1) Possivelmente contém conteúdo 2) Contém conteúdo e contém uma ou mais palavras chave desejadas pela assinatura ou não contém palavras indesejadas 3) Contém conteúdo, contém palavras desejadas e não contém palavras indesejadas
localiza a tag filha de body que possui maior quantidade de texto
Converte o elemento com maior probabilidade de ser o container do conteúdo em plain text
Verificar data container se link já foi catalogado.
docblock.long-description: Se sim, fazer idiff e rejeitar se a diferença for inferior a x% Aplicar filtros contidos em $this->subscription

parse_markers.error: No DocBlock was found for File CamelSpider/Tools/Urlizer.php

docblock.description: This is the part taken from Doctrine 1.2.3 Doctrine inflector has static methods for inflecting text
docblock.long-description:
The methods in these classes are from several different sources collected across several different php projects and several different authors. The original author names and emails are not known

Uses 3rd party libraries and functions: http://sourceforge.net/projects/phputf8

docblock.description: Check if a string has utf7 characters in it
Remove any illegal characters, accents, etc.

US-ASCII transliterations of Unicode text Ported Sean M. Burke's Text::Unidecode Perl module (He did all the hard work!) Warning: you should only pass this well formed UTF-8! Be aware it works by making a copy of the input string which it appends transliterated characters to - it uses a PHP output buffer to do this - it means, memory use will increase, requiring up to the same amount again as the input string
Does not transliterate correctly eastern languages
Uses transliteration tables to convert any kind of utf8 character
Tests a string as to whether it's valid UTF-8 and supported by the Unicode standard Note: this function has been modified to simple return true or false
Cleans up the text and adds separator
